channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWmDp5---kw
If people would want it/find it useful then I will release a short guide explaining how to do it - it obviously requires both server and client edits.

item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:7, topic:538235”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=657063.msg4395884#msg4395884 date=1389103921]

I am going to see about modifying it to allow the user to specify an RGB colour for the map, the blue was just a proof of concept.

Yeah , in that case it does make sense

Would you like me to release it when finished? It’s not a terribly large modification.

Sure why not , a lot of people including me could make a good use of it
[/quote]

Alright, when I have got the RGB colour working I will release it as a snippet/short tutorial[/quote]

Thank you

item.source: [Showoff] Improvements on the minimap state system

item.title: [Showoff] Improvements on the minimap state system
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:2, topic:538235”]Dat video quality.

It is really nice though especially the blackout , it can be really useful.
But why would you wan’t it to become blue?[/quote]
Sorry, I am uploading a higher quality video now.
As I said on Rune-Server:

This feature could be used for making it so that the player needs a compass item and a map item in order to be able to navigate as usual. Without a map, the map will be blacked out, and without a compass, the compass will be blacked out. This modification allows the two states to be changed individually.
I am going to see about modifying it to allow the user to specify an RGB colour for the map, the blue was just a proof of concept.

I’ve also uploaded a higher quality video.

Read full topic
item.source: [Showoff] Improvements on the minimap state system
